results.title: A Day at the races
results.creator_credit: Sam Wood, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A Marx Brothers movie combining humor and music. The plot, which shifts from a sanitorium to a race track, introduces a horse doctor masquerading as sanitorium director, a jockey who encourages his horse to win by showing it a picture of the man it hates, a vendor of bad racing tips and a vampire dressed in revealing clothing. Also stars Maureen O’Sullivan.

results.title: Fast talking
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Ross Matthews, AFI [au] and Old Data
results.brief_description: An Australian feature film that presents the story of fifteen year old Steve Carson, a con artist, spirited rebel and determined survivor in the face of crumbling family relationships. The many influences in his life are highlighted in a comedy of fast dialogue and outrageous escapades. Starring Rod Zuanic, Toni Allaylis, Chris Truswell, Gail Sweeny and Steve Bisley.

results.title: The Chosen
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Ely Landau, Edie Landau and Chosen Film Company
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Chaim Potok which explores the friendship that develops between two adolescent Jewish boys living in New York in the 1940s. The boys are from vastly different Jewish backgrounds, one being an Hasidic Jew and the other a Zionist. Features Rod Steiger, Maximilian Schell as the boys fathers together with Robby Benson and Barry Miller.

results.title: Elvis on tour
results.creator_credit: Robert Abel, Pierre Adigel and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Elvis Presley’s life. Shows Elvis speaking publicly for the first time about his life and career; rare footage of his early days; performance of his greatest hits including “Love me tender” and offstage moments.

results.title: A Hard day's night
results.creator_credit: Richard Lester, Walter Shenson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring the Beatles, this comic fantasia with music uses a multitude of cinematic gags. An enormous commercial success, it led directly to all the kaleidescope swinging London spy thrillers and comedies of the late sixties. In this film the Beatles, harrased by their manager and Paul’s grandpa, embark from Liverpool by train for a London television show.

results.title: Wherever she goes
results.creator_credit: Michael S. Gordon and Faun Films
results.brief_description: A film biography of Eileen Joyce, the celebrated Australian pianist concentrating on her childhood in the Tasmanian bush and the Kalgoorlie goldfields. Opening and closing scenes show the pianist herself performing at a concert. Made in Australia by the British Production House Ealing Studios.

results.title: Aussie assault
results.creator_credit: Harvey Spencer, Bill Scholer, Garry Holt and Sportmaster Programs
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.

results.title: Bugsy Malone
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, David Puttnam, Alan Marshall and Goodtimes Enterprises
results.brief_description: A mad gangster musical set in the New York of the 1920s, a world of would-be hoodlums, show girls and dreamers. But there are no adults, only children. Bugsy, Blousey, Tallulah, Fat Sam, Fizzy, Leroy and Loney are some of the characters involved in a bitter gang war for possession of the dreaded “spurge gun”. Stars a very young Jodie Foster.

results.title: WHO: The kids are alright
results.creator_credit: Jeff Stein, Tony Klinger, Bill Curbishley and BMG Music
results.brief_description: Features live performances of the Who’s most celebrated hits from “My generation” to the sophistication of the rock opera “Tommy”. Along with the guitar-smashing exuberance of the group’s stage performances, director Jeff Stein has assembled a series of interviews which reflect the collective and individual nature of the band.

results.title: Man in the white suit
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A scientist, played by Alec Guinnes, invents a fabric that never gets dirty and never wears out. Unions and management are equally perturbed by this and endeavour to prevent its manufacture. Academy Award nomination for scripting.
